meanings.definition: To make a shushing sound to quiet someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She shooshed the noisy children in the library.
meanings.sent2: Please shoosh during the movie so others can hear.
meanings.sent3: The cat shooshed the birds away from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The wind shooshed through the trees, creating a calming melody.
meanings.sent5: The teacher shooshed the class before starting the test.

meanings.definition: A command to be quiet or stop talking.
meanings.sent1: The librarian gave a quick shoosh to the chatty students.
meanings.sent2: His loud shoosh interrupted the peaceful atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent3: The baby's cry was met with a gentle shoosh from the mother.
meanings.sent4: The shoosh from the principal silenced the rowdy students instantly.
meanings.sent5: The shoosh from the referee signaled the end of the game.
